questionContent.body: In Selective Repeat, if the receiver's window size is 4 and the sender’s window is also 4, what should be the minimum number of sequence numbers (mod value)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: To avoid ambiguity, in Selective Repeat, the modulus ? 2 × window size ? 2×4 = 8

questionContent.body: A generator polynomial G(x) = x? + x + 1 is used in CRC. What is its binary representation

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: G(x) = x? + x + 1 ? binary: 1x? + 0x³ + 0x² + 1x¹ + 1 ? 10011

questionContent.body: In CSMA/CA (used in Wi-Fi), what mechanism helps avoid collisions

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: RTS/CTS (Request to Send / Clear to Send) helps reduce collisions by managing channel access before data is sent.

questionContent.body: Which field of the PPP frame indicates the protocol being used (e.g., IP, IPX)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The protocol field in PPP specifies which network layer protocol (e.g., IPv4, IPv6) is encapsulated.

questionContent.body: Which MAC protocol divides time into equal slots and assigns them to users

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: TDMA (Time Division Multiple Access) avoids collision by giving each station a fixed time slot.

questionContent.body: In HDLC, which frame type is used for flow and error control

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Supervisory frames (S-frames) in HDLC are used for flow and error control (e.g., ACKs, REJ).

questionContent.body: Which error correction technique can correct a single-bit error and detect two-bit errors

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Hamming codes are designed for single-bit correction and double-bit detection.

questionContent.body: If a system uses even parity for error detection, which of the following sequences is invalid

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 1110001 has 5 ones (odd) — invalid for even parity.

questionContent.body: In the Stop-and-Wait protocol, what happens if the ACK is lost

questionOptions.body: Sender resends the frame after timeout

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In absence of ACK, timeout triggers retransmission in Stop-and-Wait.

questionContent.body: What is the minimum number of bits required to represent sequence numbers if a sliding window protocol has a sender window size of 15

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: For a window size of 15, we need at least 5 bits: 25=322^5 = 3225=32, which is enough to represent sequence numbers 0–31.

questionContent.body: Which of these best describes error correction techniques

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Error correction (like Hamming) uses extra bits to detect and fix errors without retransmission.

questionContent.body: In a Stop-and-Wait protocol, if bandwidth is 10 Mbps and RTT is 50 ms, max efficiency is approximately

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Efficiency = Frame transmission time / (RTT + transmission time). With large RTT, efficiency is very low.

questionContent.body: The max efficiency of Slotted ALOHA is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Efficiency of Slotted ALOHA = 1/e ? 0.368 or 36.8%

questionContent.body: In Bit Stuffing, if a sequence “01111110” appears in data, what will be transmitted

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: After five 1’s, a 0 is inserted ? 0111110 becomes 011111010 to avoid flag confusion.

questionContent.body: If RTT is 20ms and bandwidth is 1 Mbps, what is the bandwidth-delay product (BDP)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: BDP = bandwidth × RTT = 1 × 10? × 20 × 10?³ = 20,000 bits

questionContent.body: If the bit error rate (BER) is 10??, the expected number of errors in a 1MB file is closest to

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: 1MB = 8 × 10? bits. BER = 10?? ? Expected errors = 8 × 10? × 10?? = 8 errors.

questionContent.body: A CRC generator polynomial is G(x) = x? + x + 1. What is the divisor in binary

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Convert the polynomial to binary: x? + x + 1 ? 1x? + 0x³ + 0x² + 1x¹ + 1 = 10011

questionContent.body: Which protocol has the best bandwidth utilization under high error conditions

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Since only erroneous frames are resent, Selective Repeat is more efficient in error-prone environments.

questionContent.body: What is the minimum frame size required in Ethernet to ensure collision detection

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: To ensure collision detection, Ethernet requires a minimum frame size of 64 bytes (including header).

questionContent.body: Which HDLC frame type is used to acknowledge frames and provide flow control

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Supervisory (S) frames are used for acknowledgments and control (like RR, RNR, REJ).

questionContent.body: What is the main drawback of using character-count framing

questionOptions.body: Frame sync is lost if count field is corrupted

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: If the length field is wrong due to error, entire frame alignment gets lost — very risky in unreliable media.

questionContent.body: Which type of ARQ uses selective retransmission of only erroneous frames

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Selective Repeat improves efficiency by retransmitting only the specific frames that were corrupted.

questionContent.body: In Ethernet (IEEE 802.3), which access method is used

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Ethernet uses Carrier Sense Multiple Access with Collision Detection to manage shared channel access.

questionContent.body: What is the purpose of the 'start' and 'end' delimiters in character-count framing

questionOptions.body: Detect start and end of frame

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Delimiters help receiver distinguish where each frame starts and ends, ensuring proper parsing.

questionContent.body: Which protocol does not use acknowledgment for flow control

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: ALOHA is a random access protocol with no ACK/NAK mechanism, unlike ARQ-based protocols.

questionContent.body: Which statement is false about CRC

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: CRC is only for detection, not correction. Correction requires Hamming or similar codes.

questionContent.body: In a Go-Back-N protocol, if the sender's window size is N, the maximum number of unacknowledged frames is

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Sender can send up to N unacknowledged frames before stopping

questionContent.body: Which of these is a byte-oriented protocol

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: PPP is a byte-oriented protocol used for point-to-point links and uses byte stuffing.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is true for Pure ALOHA

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Pure ALOHA’s efficiency is 12e?18.4%\frac{1}{2e} \approx 18.4\%; it allows random transmission and suffers from collisions.

questionContent.body: What is the role of the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) in a data frame

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: FCS is part of the trailer and is used for error checking, often containing CRC results.

questionContent.body: Bit stuffing ensures that

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Bit stuffing prevents the occurrence of flag patterns (like 01111110) in data by inserting a '0' after five 1s.

questionContent.body: In Selective Repeat, if receiver receives frame 5 before frame 4, it will

questionOptions.body: Buffer frame 5 and wait for frame 4

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Selective Repeat allows out-of-order frames and buffers them until missing ones arrive.

questionContent.body: Which field in a frame is used to detect errors

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: CRC or checksum fields are specifically used to detect errors in transmitted data.

questionContent.body: What is the main issue in using parity for error detection in large data blocks

questionOptions.body: Cannot detect even number of bit errors

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Simple parity can only detect odd number of bit errors. It fails on even-bit errors.

questionContent.body: In a Go-Back-N protocol with window size 3 and sequence numbers 0–7, if ACK 2 is lost, what happens

questionOptions.body: All frames from 2 onwards are retransmitted after timeout

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Go-Back-N does not receive ACK 2, so on timeout, it resends all frames starting from 2.

questionContent.body: Which MAC protocol avoids collisions by using time-slots assigned to stations

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Time Division Multiple Access assigns time slots to users to avoid collision completely.

questionContent.body: A Hamming code with 4 redundancy bits can protect how many data bits (maximum)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Hamming code rule: 2^r ? m + r + 1 ? r = 4 ? 2? = 16 ? m + 4 + 1 ? max m = 11.

questionContent.body: Which of the following is true about Stop-and-Wait protocol

questionOptions.body: Sender must wait for ACK before next frame

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In Stop-and-Wait, sender sends one frame and waits for acknowledgment before sending the next.

questionContent.body: In CSMA/CD, if a collision is detected, what does the sender do

questionOptions.body: Stop transmission, wait a random time, and retry

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: After collision detection, CSMA/CD uses exponential backoff to avoid repeated collisions.

questionContent.body: In HDLC, which frame type is used to carry user data

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: I-frames carry actual user data. S-frames are for flow/error control; U-frames are used for link management.

questionContent.body: In bit stuffing, the pattern 0111110 is used as a flag. What is transmitted if the data is 011111

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A ‘0’ is inserted after five consecutive 1’s to avoid confusion with the delimiter ? becomes 01111101.

questionContent.body: A 1000-byte frame has a 2-bit error. Which method can guarantee detection but not correction

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: CRC can detect multi-bit errors, but cannot correct them — unlike Hamming, which can correct single-bit errors.

questionContent.body: Which framing technique uses character-level data with special start and end characters

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Byte Stuffing uses special characters like ESC to differentiate control info from data.

questionContent.body: In a sliding window protocol, if sender’s window size is 4 and receiver’s window size is 1, which protocol is it

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Go-Back-N allows multiple frames to be sent, but only 1 ACK at a time — thus receiver window = 1.

questionContent.body: A network uses CRC with a generator polynomial G(x) = x³ + x + 1. What is the binary form of the divisor
What is the minimum number of redundancy bits required to detect and correct single-bit errors in a 7-bit message

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: For Hamming code, the minimum r such that 2^r ? m + r + 1 ? for m=7 ? r=4.

questionContent.body: Which error detection method can detect all single-bit and burst errors (less than the generator length)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: CRC is powerful for detecting all single-bit errors and burst errors shorter than the polynomial length.

questionContent.body: In Selective Repeat ARQ, to avoid ambiguity, the window size must be ? ___ if m bits are used for sequence numbers

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: To avoid ambiguity between new and old frames, the window size must be ? half the sequence number space.

questionContent.body: The window size in Go-Back-N ARQ is 7. What is the range of sequence numbers needed (modulo value)

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: For Go-Back-N, maximum window size = N – 1. So, for a window size of 7, sequence numbers need 3 bits (mod 8).

questionContent.body: In the Stop-and-Wait ARQ protocol, if the sender times out waiting for an ACK, it will

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Stop-and-Wait uses timeout and ACKs to ensure delivery. If ACK is not received in time, the same frame is resent.

questionContent.body: What resolves duplication or failure in Stop-and-Wait ARQ

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Sequence numbers help receiver detect duplicate frames and prevent reprocessing.

questionContent.body: Which device operates at the Data Link Layer

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Switches use MAC addresses and operate at layer 2 (Data Link Layer) to forward frames.

questionContent.body: Which objectives does the Data Link Layer fulfill

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: It handles frame synchronization, error control, and flow control — all are key responsibilities.

questionContent.body: A bit-stuffing framing protocol uses delimiter 01111110. If output is 01111100101, what’s the input

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: A '0' is inserted after 5 consecutive 1’s. To recover input, remove the stuffed '0' ? gives 0111110101.

questionContent.body: CRC uses polynomial division. Which statement is true

questionOptions.body: Append (degree of divisor) zeros before division
CRC can correct single-bit errors only

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: CRC generation involves appending zeros (based on divisor degree), then dividing to get the remainder.

questionContent.body: In CRC, if the data unit is 100111001 and the divisor is 1011, what is the dividend at the receiver

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The sender appends the CRC remainder (3 bits here) to the original data, forming the full frame.

questionContent.body: Which error detection method uses one's complement arithmetic

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: In checksum, all data words are added using one’s complement, and the final sum’s complement is sent.

questionContent.body: What is the disadvantage of burst errors compared to single-bit errors

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Burst errors affect multiple bits at once, making detection and correction more complex.

questionContent.body: What is the Hamming distance between 1010101 and 1100110

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Hamming distance = number of differing bit positions ? 4 bits differ.

questionContent.body: Which sublayer handles functions that are media-dependent

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The MAC sublayer manages access to the physical medium, which depends on the transmission method (wired/wireless).

questionContent.body: Which task is not performed by the data link layer

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: Channel coding (like modulation) is done at the physical layer, not the data link layer.

questionContent.body: The data link layer takes the packets from ___ and encapsulates them into frames for transmission

solution.name: Solution 1
solution.details: The network layer passes packets to the data link layer, which adds headers/trailers and creates frames.
